sentences: Varem oli rohkem mehi kui naisi.
Sellel töölõpul võib osaleda mitu mehi.
context: "Mehi" is the partitive plural form of the Estonian word "mees" (man/male). The partitive case in Estonian typically indicates an incomplete or indefinite quantity, so "mehi" would translate to "some men" or "men" when referring to a group without specifying the exact number. It's commonly used when talking about men in general, or an unspecified number of men.
